Token.Abstract: Object mapper for domain-object interaction with DynamoDB.
The service configuration used to instantiate this service client.
The service configuration used to instantiate this service client.
The service configuration used to instantiate this service client.

Returns the singleton service client. If the singleton object does not exist, the SDK instantiates the default service client with defaultServiceConfiguration from [AWSServiceManager defaultServiceManager]. The reference to this object is maintained by the SDK, and you do not need to retain it manually.
Creates a service client with the given service configuration and registers it for the key.

Parameter.Name: objectMapperConfiguration
Parameter.Abstract: The DynamoDB Object Mapper configuration object.

Parameter.Name: key
Parameter.Abstract: A string to identify the service client.

Token.Abstract: Retrieves the service client associated with the key. You need to call + registerDynamoDBObjectMapperWithConfiguration:forKey: before invoking this method.

Parameter.Name: key
Parameter.Abstract: A string to identify the service client.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An instance of the service client.

Token.Abstract: Removes the service client associated with the key and release it.

Parameter.Name: key
Parameter.Abstract: A string to identify the service client.

Token.Abstract: Saves the model object to an Amazon DynamoDB table using the default configuration.
Saves the model object to an Amazon DynamoDB table using the default configuration.

Parameter.Name: completionHandler
Parameter.Abstract: The completion handler to call when the load request is complete. error: An error object that indicates why the request failed, or nil if the request was successful.

Token.Abstract: Saves the model object to an Amazon DynamoDB table using the specified configuration.

Parameter.Name: completionHandler
Parameter.Abstract: The completion handler to call when the load request is complete. error: An error object that indicates why the request failed, or nil if the request was successful.

Token.Abstract: Removes the given model object from the Amazon DynamoDB table using the default configuration.

Token.Abstract: Returns an object with the given hash key and the range key (if it exists), or nil if no such object exists.

Parameter.Name: resultClass
Parameter.Abstract: The class of the result object.

Token.Abstract: Returns an object with the given hash key and the range key (if it exists), or nil if no such object exists.
Token.Declaration: - (void)load:(Class)resultClass hashKey:(id)hashKey rangeKey:(nullable id)rangeKey completionHandler:(void ( ^ _Nullable ) ( AWSDynamoDBObjectModel<AWSDynamoDBModeling> *_Nullable response , NSError *_Nullable error ))completionHandler

Parameter.Name: resultClass
Parameter.Abstract: The class of the result object.

Parameter.Name: completionHandler

Token.Abstract: Queries an Amazon DynamoDB table and returns the matching results as an unmodifiable list of instantiated objects, using the default configuration.

Parameter.Name: resultClass
Parameter.Abstract: The class of the result object.

Token.Abstract: Queries an Amazon DynamoDB table and returns the matching results as an unmodifiable list of instantiated objects.
Token.Declaration: - (void)query:(Class)resultClass expression:(AWSDynamoDBQueryExpression *)expression completionHandler:(void ( ^ _Nullable ) ( AWSDynamoDBPaginatedOutput *_Nullable response , NSError *_Nullable error ))completionHandler

Parameter.Name: resultClass
Parameter.Abstract: The class of the result object.

Parameter.Name: completionHandler
Parameter.Abstract: The completion handler to call when the load request is complete. response: AWSDynamoDBPaginatedOutput that contains a list of model objects, or nil if no such object exists. error: An error object that indicates why the request failed, or nil if the request was successful.

Token.Abstract: Scans through an Amazon DynamoDB table and returns the matching results as an AWSDynamoDBPaginatedOutput of instantiated objects, using the default configuration.
